website_summaries.verdict: This is a good-quality, basic steam iron at a price that will fit comfortably into anyone's budget.
pros: Smart Steam technology regulates amount of steam based on temperature setting
Nonstick soleplate glides smoothly across fabric
cons: This model doesn't have an on-off switch, so you'll have to either unplug it or wait for the auto shutoff

customer_reviews.title: 1 Star Reviews Are Most Likely User Error
customer_reviews.text: I became very worried after ordering because I didn't see all the 1 star reviews. Once I received it I immediately used it, and was instantly relieved. There's one part I left out, and that is I read the instruction manual. It does not have an off switch, but you can turn the all the way down, however as per the manual you should unplug it when you're finished ironing. I primarily purchased this iron to press my collars and for sewing. My only hesitation about using it for my slacks is the size. It's small and compact- exactly the reason I bought it. Don't pass this up because most people haven't figured out how to read a user manual.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: No on/off switch!!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay very much for this iron and didn't really expect anything great. What I don't understand is that there's no on/off switch. I get that it has auto shut off but that means when I'm done using it, I either have to unplug it or if I just leave it alone, it will shut off in 8 minutes. That seems wasteful and frankly a little bit dangerous. Not sure I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Iron
customer_reviews.text: Bought this iron recently and after using it for about 2 weeks it doesnt work anymore. I noticed shortly after i got it that the auto steamer was spotty, it wouldnt always engage when set down even when iron was hot. After using it for about 2 weeks all of a sudden it wouldnt warm up. I set it to the highest setting and the iron is ice cold. I've tried leaving it on for about 10 minutes at the highest setting and still cold. Save yourself some time having to send this back and just get a better iron right off the back.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Reyes

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 2 months and one day it just wouldn't turn on. The water was constantly leaking when it did work and it didn't really do the best job ironing to begin with. For $17 I really can't be too angry but I was a bit disappointed that it didn't even last a year. I wouldn't recommend purchasing this. Don't be cheap like me - get a good iron.
customer_reviews.author: Satty

customer_reviews.title: This iron is worst. It spits
customer_reviews.text: Turns out you actually do get what you pay for, and my cheaping-out on this one was so not worth what I thought I was saving. Don't let the Black & Decker name fool you. This iron is worst. It spits, sputters, makes gurgling noises, and dribbles water ALL OVER everything. I have never ironed a piece of clothing with this when it hasn't left water marks on the item. I'm so done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good iron for occasional use, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Good all around cheap iron, heats up fast and is very light and maneuverable. The steam burst puts out a HUGE amount of steam, probably it's best attribute, and I haven't noticed any sticking like I did on the last iron (don't remember the brand right off.) I haven't seen any dripping yet, but it's still new. My only real complaint is the lack of an off switch for STEAM. There are times when you want maximum heat without steam, like starching heavy weight fabrics. On this iron, the only way to get that is to empty the water.
customer_reviews.author: WesWooHoo

customer_reviews.title: Leaking and weird sounds
customer_reviews.text: I got a replacement from amazon as my brand new iron was leaking water and making weird sounds! It leaves water marks on clothes and sprays out out water as soon as you lift it. This is unsafe as this could emd up burning your skin. I would not recommed this at all. I am ataching video for reference. Update: The steam stopped working after 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: Great steaming settings
customer_reviews.text: So my husband loves this clothes iron! It works better than any iron we’ve ever had. Now reviews were saying it leaks, but that’s when you put it on moisture mode and as long as you are moving it to iron your clothes, that’s what it’s suppose to do. There are 3 levels for no moisture and 3 levels with moisture. When you got wrinkly clothes like us, the moisture levels work great, they output a lot of moisture so the clothes get almost steamed straight. This works really good, and really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Meyer family

customer_reviews.title: The worst designed Iron ever
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the person who designed this iron has no concept of engineering, or never used an iron before, but the reservoir opening is so shallow that no matter how small amount of water you put in it will splash on your clothes. Even the slowest and slightest movements will cause water to pour out of the front of this iron. I guess if you don't need steam this iron is OK. But to call it no drip is laughable. Maybe they called it no drip because it splashes instead. Walk away and buy something designed by people who know what they are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for low price
customer_reviews.text: I am not that picky when it comes to irons, but I'd say for the average person with the average wardrobe, this iron is perfect! I have had no issues with it, and it gets the wrinkles out of my clothes easy-peasy, exactly what I was looking for. Just don't go shake it around too quickly when using it, as the water will escape the chamber and get on your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: MPerron

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any issues with it, but I've only used it a couple times. It's super light tho and heats up well. If I have any issues in the future I'll change the review.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah T

customer_reviews.title: MINI_IRON
customer_reviews.text: I like this iron, but please take note that it is a MINI Iron. I have an over-the-door rack for my ironing board and iron, but this iron is so small it falls out of the spot where the iron is suppose to go. Also, with this iron being so small, it takes a lot more time to iron items. But, I figured it was a good brand, so I tried it out. Just remember guys, it's SMALL!
customer_reviews.author: aunt emma

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Even Last 6 Months.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 5 months. At first the power-on light would come on, but would not heat up. You have to unplug and replug it in to make it heat up. After one week of this, it stopped working completely and now the power light wont come on and it does not heat up at all. My last iron lasted 10 years....this one not even 6 months!
customer_reviews.author: Travor

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't worth it
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 4 stars 1 month after I purchased it, and this was my comment: rather than its look it works great for the price, it doesn't leak, and the steam pressure is actually great. I'm changing it to one star because it just broke after 9 months, we even didn't use it that much, so I it doesn't worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Milad

customer_reviews.title: Read comments!
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this on August 4, today is August 31 and it has quit working in the middle of my ironing. Now that I read all the comments that I should have looked at before hand, I find it was a bad purchase to start with. It doesn’t matter if it is lightweight, or has good maneuverability. The fact that it quit on me already is irritating. I trusted black and decker and that was a mistake. I do not know if I can return it without the box but I would love to send it back to somebody.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely drips, steam not very "smart"
customer_reviews.text: They should have just stuck with advertising lightweight and cheap. Those things are true. But it drips constantly regardless of fill level and the "smart" steam works a little over half the time LOL I don't care, just needed a temporary thing and dripping doesn't hurt my clothes. If it lasts a while it was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Iron!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst iron I have ever bought! It replaced another B&D iron I had for 29 years. This is nothing like the 1989 B&D. This thing sticks to clothes. When you use spray starch, it wont even move without leaving streaks. After just a couple months use, the water randomly pours out onto the clothes as you iron leaving huge wet patches. This thing is useless and is going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good iron power cord brittle.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good iron. Had it not been for a slight knowledge of electronics I would probably give this product one star. As the power cord where it extends from the chassis of the iron so to speak is brittle. This broke after a few months of use. And would break again after repair. I recommend changing the wire or fabricating another exit as the way in which it is engineered puts too much strain on the brittle wire.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Medium Size Iron
customer_reviews.text: Light weight medium size iron. Heats quickly and glides smoothly. Great steam output. It is light enough for use with arthritic hands without seeming too small. Very pleased with this iron.
customer_reviews.author: ladybutterfly102

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, easy to use. I haven't used the steam on it yet, so I can't speak for any leaking problems. It is an eco friendly iron so it does shut on and off every so often to save electricity but I didn't notice any inconsistencies in my fabric.
customer_reviews.author: PenelopetheFish

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working 2 Months In
customer_reviews.text: I knew this was a quick purchase iron - not necessarily an investment. However, it worked just fine for two months and then went completely cold. The light still goes on, but no heat. I never filled it with water due to the other reviews that it leaks, so that is not part of of the problem. My issue is, now I cannot return it and get my money back because it it past Amazon's 30 day return policy. I am disappointed and inconvenienced!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron for my son to take to college because he needed to have an iron with an automatic shut off. Of course as a college student he’s never used it. I was recently there and went to iron a shirt for him and all the water spills out of the bottom. It was the first time it has ever been used and of course it’s too late to return it. Big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Pasquarella

customer_reviews.title: Decent iron
customer_reviews.text: Okay product for the price. The iron isn’t as heavy as I like irons to me. 1 thing I would say I ABSOLUTELY dislike about the iron is that you can’t control the steam option there’s no button and the steam only comes out when the temperature setting is on high which has burned some on my clothes. I figured out how to make it work for my life right now but I will definitely be buying a better iron soon.
customer_reviews.author: Evey_Mel

customer_reviews.title: Quickly stops working
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL This is my second one. The first I got from someone new in box and it stopped working after a few months. It just suddenly wouldn't heat up. I got another not realizing it was the same. I ordered Jan 26th. Today is the 10th of Feb and after a handful of uses the freaking thing stopped working in the middle of me ironing work clothes. This is a POS iron.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Perler Beads.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so there are a ton of reviews saying that it makes your clothes super wet, and doesn't do a great job of not leaking. But I bought this for perler beading and it is by far, the best purchase I could have ever made. Not having to deal with water eliminates the problems people are having with it. I love the auto switch off; I just leave it plugged in and tip it over to make it heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Hasbrouck

customer_reviews.title: I especially like this iron because it is a bit smaller in ...
customer_reviews.text: I especially like this iron because it is a bit smaller in size so it is easier to handle. And the settings for types of fabric is on the top not hidden under the handle where you can hardly see the dial as on many of the irons these days.
customer_reviews.author: LardareK

customer_reviews.title: Super Light
customer_reviews.text: I love black decker for my irons. Its super easy, light and heats up. What I like about it is that when its done heating, it will beep to let you know when to use it. What I also like is that when you lift it up and use it and put it back upright, it will heat up again. Its easy and I hope it lasts for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Soubi Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great smaller iron and works well!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a cute lil iron! It’s about an inch smaller than a regular iron and it’s perfect for me! I do crafts and sewing so it’s the perfect size. It works great and it’s lightweight. I recommend it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: That it would TURN ON when plugged
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mid Feb 2020.... by mid-Apr.2020 stopped working AT ALL. No light, no warmth, NOT WORKING!!! I used to have a similar model, Black and Decker, for MANY YEARS... probably 15 or so without problems. Deadline for return was mid-March.... so I am OUT OF LUCK!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Nice

customer_reviews.title: Died an early death after little use....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in January 2018. It was minimally used. Today, June, 2019 it stopped working. On hottest temperature setting I could hold my hand against it after 30 mins of waiting. Needless to say I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: homeslice614

customer_reviews.title: This product DOES NOT last AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new iron on March 23, 2018. I have used it twice since then and the non-stick coating on the bottom of the iron is peeling off in large pieces! I do not have the original box, therefore, cannot return, furthermore, the "return window" is closed. I don't iron often, but didn't expect the iron to wear out in just two uses. I had my other iron for over 25 years! They certainly don't make items like they use to. I am VERY upset about this. I would/will NOT recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very decent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand what is about all the negative reviews. This is a steamed iron for less than $20 and it does what it supposed to do considering the price. I use bottled spring water for steaming and it works perfectly. I only used it a a few times and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Good for short time
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I thought its cheap and I will get an iron any way. It is really cheap but the problem is leaking. The water leaks on the fabric constantly. Also when you plug it in, and it warms up there is a smell like burned plastic. If you have a lot of ironing do not buy this. I think it wont last more than a year. But for the price and if you have a little ironing, its not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: sainamaali

customer_reviews.title: wrong size for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting it to be much smaller. Instead, it was pretty much standard size. I needed a very small iron that I could keep with me to iron on name labels on my husband's clothes because he's in a nursing home setting. I finally found one at Hobby Lobby that was about 4" tall and was just what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Carver

customer_reviews.title: Flashes constantly when shut off
customer_reviews.text: Flashes all the time even when shut off. Irritating! I would unplug it but the plug is behind the dresser. When it’s off the red light should go out. And not a heavy iron so it takes a little more pressure than I’d like. Definitely would not recommend- you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Golden

customer_reviews.title: Water Spitting from water tank opening
customer_reviews.text: This product could have been perfect if the opening for the water tank was enclosed. Even if you fill out the tank to the max level, it ALWAYS spit some water while ironing! So, the clothes get sprayed with the water and no matter how you maneuver the iron slowly..... water comes out of the tank's opening. I put a cotton ball in the opening so it will not spit water while ironing. One feature that makes me decide to keep it is that the iron is so light.
customer_reviews.author: Leena

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker failed me
customer_reviews.text: This did not steam and it broke down in one month and it did not want to restart. It was working a little in our travel trailer. I would not buy another one again.. If I could I would return but I am over the 30 day.s I am surprised because Black and Decker normally have good.
customer_reviews.author: Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was loving this iron have had it a couple months, all of a sudden the steam button stopped working, not very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travel
customer_reviews.text: We bought this primarily because it was budget friendly. I was surprised I wasn't expecting a lot out of this travel iron. It is just a simple basic iron. There are no fancy buttons, no bells or whistles but it gets the job done. It's not huge but a little bigger than the irons you might find in a hotel, it works better too. It's just a simple bare bones, light weight iron.
customer_reviews.author: A Austin

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Light weight & quick to heat. I don't expect this to last forever obviously but it suites my needs. I haven't had it but for a couple weeks.Our quilting guild has a number of these so that's why I went with it. Not much else you can really say about an inexpensive iron.
customer_reviews.author: E. K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a knob to change cloth type would be better
customer_reviews.text: I use this product mostly for my formal wears which are usually cotton. I have had no problems till now. But if I want to use this product for other fibers like wool or polyester then I don't see any knob or switch that can change the temperature of the iron to suit that type of clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Pokharel

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good, not the most amazing iron, but for the price I can’t complain. I don’t wear a suit or formal wear all the time so I don’t really use an iron too often. I think this iron would work great for the occasional shirt and tie wearer.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I mean its a black and decker.....
customer_reviews.text: So it works as it should. Good brand. Good iron. Gets hot fast, steam function works nice. I use it for ironing out my material for sewing and it works really good on the creases from folding.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Irwin

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for HTV To transfer vinyl on to fabris works great. It does have an auto shut off but it doesnt shut off the entire iron just turns off the heat but if i left it on id be happy that it cools down
customer_reviews.author: Linsay Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, steamer didn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: The water hole in the front doesn't have a cover, if you try to go fast the water will splash out. The steamer didn't work reliably on mine (sometimes I got some steam, sometime holding it in mid air for 30 seconds and I got nothing). Not a good purchase; spend $10 more and get something better made.
customer_reviews.author: 3DReview

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: The hole for the eater has no cover and the water can come out while using it (or feels like it...) No steam function, it shoots hot water when pressing the button on the handle. Scolding hot water drips in big amounts from the bottom. I burned my foot twice, it left scars
customer_reviews.author: Mma

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I've used it several times and still can't quite figure out how the steam button works...it sprays water fine but the steam seems to be temperamental...it's fine though-great price
customer_reviews.author: E. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Splashes water at random, even when the water is halfway full. A lot of soggy messes for me, which is a bummer when you’re in a rush. Left for work a couple of times with soaking wet blotches. Heats up fast, is lightweight, but settings aren’t easy to gauge temperature at first and there is no steam button, which I guess I didn’t expect wasn’t a standard for irons. Used it a couple of times and now it sits in my closet :(
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Bayer

customer_reviews.title: Its NOT Black & Decker Its Black + Decker
customer_reviews.text: Its NOT your well known trusted brand Black & Decker !!! Its a Black + Decker !!! The red light on every trditional iron goes OFF when it reaches your desired temperature . This one will not !!! Filling the water tank is not easy, it really needs handcraft or water will spill on your floor, carpet etc.
customer_reviews.author: EMRE YIGITBAS

customer_reviews.title: The water container was dirty! So the first time that I used it
customer_reviews.text: The water container was dirty! So the first time that I used it, it messed up my black shirt BIG TIME. So emptied the water and tried to clean up as much as I could still couldn't completely clean it. So you might wanna use it on some cheap cloth or something a few times before you actually iron anything
customer_reviews.author: maryam lamei

customer_reviews.title: It gives your clothes a professional finish.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sign because it gets out the wrinkles efficiently and fast. The steam goes where you want it to go, and not anywhere else. And it's easy to clean I prefer a heavier iron, and when it is filled with water it has substantial weight. It gives your clothes a professional finish.
customer_reviews.author: L' Marie

customer_reviews.title: No complaints so far!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little iffy on how this iron would be after mixed reviews and the price being so much lower than others. Figured I would give it a shot and it has not let me down! Irons very nicely and doesn’t leak water about 3 months in. Heats up fairly quickly and easy to pick settings. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Umayr A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap iron for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The iron leaks a couple drops of water when you turn it over after it’s been standing on its base. There is no plug to keep the water in the reservoir from coming out. Feels lightweight and cheap. Works fine for someone who doesn’t iron regularly (me).
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Not hot enough
customer_reviews.text: The iron is very light weight. Love that it shuts itself off due but hates that it will shut off even when using it. Doesn't get very hot even in highest setting. Steaming feature is awsome.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Simple and compact iron
customer_reviews.text: Nice small iron, heats up fast, lightweight, and plenty of settings. I like the rotating cord, it makes it easy to use the iron at different angles.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time on this product
customer_reviews.text: I would give no stars if I can. Don't waste your time on this product. Came in with the box but without instructions? Took a while to figure out where to fill the water.. and yea, you have to fill water into that rectangular space without any other tool provided. Usually it gets the entire iron wet and makes a huge mess. As I was holding it with the bottom faced downward, water spilled all over my shirt. Honestly,WTF? it was the worst experience ever. The item should be removed & the provider needs to stop buying positive reviews. And this item cost almost 20 bucks? Doesn't even worth the price of 2cents. Piece of garbage overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jejliu

customer_reviews.title: 6 months use and now dead!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron in 8/18 - it died a month ago - and by die I mean the light were on but no heat came on. Cheap enough to buy but, seriously, I thought Black and Decker had a better reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cricut HTC projects
customer_reviews.text: I purchase to use it when customizing shirts with HTV and it's perfect. I ended up going with the east press by cricut for that but honestly I like this better.
customer_reviews.author: MsMonyReads

customer_reviews.title: My Sewing Iron
customer_reviews.text: Yay! Exactly what I needed and at the price I was willing to spend. I like the easy access to the controls and the automatic shut off.
customer_reviews.author: B. Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but does the job effectively. Steam works well without sprinkling my clothes. Also have tested the auto shut off and works perfectly! Buy this item!
customer_reviews.author: Koda's Maki Girl

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 2 months.. And I don't use it that often... Stopped working in the middle if ironing...
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't cost too much and didn't end up being worth it. Heated inconsistently or not at all, vertical-steam feature didn't work at all. Leaked out of the base plate on several garments... It wasn't as hard to fill as some reviewers stated. You just have to go slow. And the 360 swivel cord was an okay feature.
customer_reviews.author: Louis E.

customer_reviews.title: No water plug
customer_reviews.text: It's an iron, it does the ironing. The only thing that drives me batty is there's no plug for the water hole, so one wrong move and it splashes everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle

customer_reviews.title: BURNED my SHEETS and LEAKS everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: This is awful. It says it doesn’t leak water, but it does. It also burned my sheets and I had it on the correct setting. Very disappointed and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Mom and Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great for melting ski wax!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to a wax iron for tuning skis and snow boards (wax irons can be over $100). It works perfectly on the #3 setting for this purpose. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: random shopper

customer_reviews.title: and is easy to store /set up The brand name again has ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very leased with the way this Iron handles It is not too heavy, works well on different types of fibers and material, and is easy to store /set up The brand name again has proven to be reliable . GHS
customer_reviews.author: Gisela H. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: I’m not pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Iron on February 2018 & it’s not working at this moment. I’m not sure if it’s manufacturing problem or not. When I plug it the light is on the iron is not hot
customer_reviews.author: Cano Family

customer_reviews.title: Stay away, buy anything else!
customer_reviews.text: Utterly useless trash and that is me being nice about it. It will not do the job, unless you wish to be frustrated with water leaking everywhere and nothing working the way it should, then this is the iron for you!
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: good for price
customer_reviews.text: I have had no issues with the iron. To be honest this is the first iron ive purchased in many years! So I was pleased with the price and the ease of product.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Casteel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This iron is truly lightweight and easy to use, but unfortunately it does not work. It stopped heating already, being used 2 times a week, for 5 weeks, and now it simply does not heat. Junk. I want to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Art Lover 27

customer_reviews.title: Weird brown stain after a few months of usage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother since our old one went bad. It worked well for the first few months. It does what it is made to do. But recently, it’s been leaving like a brown stain on the ironing board. I mean, no matter what, it shouldn’t be leaving a stain. I’m not too sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Morales Jr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We iron alot mainly work clothes or dress clothes so it's holding up. It makes a weird steam noise but works real good.
customer_reviews.author: PatrishaPhilly43

customer_reviews.title: Good Iron for the everyday household
customer_reviews.text: Everyone in my house uses this iron and I've heard no complaints about it. I love that it automatically regulates steam so I don't always have to press the spray water button. Helps to get out those wrinkles even faster. Pressing clothes with this iron has been a breeze. Quickly heats up so i can quickly run the iron over my shirt before leaving home.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Riley

customer_reviews.title: One pass with this iron and ur ready. Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This black & decker iron is absolutely perfect for everyday use. Even if you are a person who irons last minute all the time or some of the time, one pass and ur clothes or household linens are ready for use. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic iron. Lighweight, easy to use, however th steam doesn't really work and water usually drips out while ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great iron for the price! Steam is great too. Easily maneuverable on shirts. I usually take my shirts to the cleaners but once in a while I need my shirts ironed and steamed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This iron did not last long at all. I used the iron almost everyday for a month or so before I threw it away and brought a new iron. Don’t waste your money on this product. It ruin several of my work uniforms with grit stains. Grit would build up on the bottom of the iron with every use. I’d scrape it off, only for it to return and ruin my cloths.
customer_reviews.author: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Is light weight and easy to use. Self explanatory. Wrinkle free. Packed and shipped timely.
customer_reviews.author: miller

customer_reviews.title: Work
customer_reviews.text: Well, I always say you pay what you get. If you use this iron for travel use, it works because it’s small but if you use it daily, then not this type.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetwood

customer_reviews.title: Noisy steam?
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron BUT makes a strange growling sound each time I lower the iron to press my clothes. Something to do with the steam. It works but it’s noisy.
customer_reviews.author: S oshi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: This basically does what it needs to without bells and whistles. My one complaint is that it's difficult to fill with water, but other than that, it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan and Josephine H.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great iron-perfect for everyday use. Only downside is there is no cap to keep water inside the tank from spilling out when/if iron is jostled. As long as your careful and don’t overfill, you should be good but just an FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: non-steaming iron
customer_reviews.text: the iron functions do not work...the steam portion was just warm - temp would not rise - in essence the steam was non-functioning. I now see that I had only til July 17th to return. Just went into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: B. SCOFIELD

customer_reviews.title: Iron you glad I did this review?
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time owning and using an iron. I love it and it gives me a nostalgic feeling! It’s easy to use and heats up nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Selene Stars

customer_reviews.title: Little iron, big steam, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for training you son and/or daughter to iron! This was my choice for child going off to boot camp. Has served him well! He was the only one who knew how to press pants!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hall-Lennier

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS DESCRIBED
customer_reviews.text: Got this to due crafting with didn't get hot enough for heat bonding of which was main reason I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Iron and Spaceship all in one
customer_reviews.text: This iron is hot! I actually don't like doing chores such as ironing, so it's hard to give a chore tool a high rating. I give this iron a 5 because it doubles as an imaginary spaceship when I am bored. Good stuff and works well for both uses!
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Clean Pressed and Satiated from an Iron?  Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What a good iron. I use this to press my Navy dress blues and it does an outstanding job. When done, I can even toast a grilled cheese sandwich on it while it is still hot...that's everything to a barracks dweller like myself.
customer_reviews.author: @pickerofcrabapples

customer_reviews.title: Decent Iron
customer_reviews.text: OK, I didn't purchase for ironing clothes, but I used for wood edge-banding touchup that uses pre-applied hot melt glue. It is nice and light, only complaint is no shut off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron is not worth the trouble. It spills water all over your clothing when ironing. Just buy one that cost a little more because this is a headache when trying to get ready quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Raye

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted two months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron in August 2018 and for two months it was a great iron. This iron has stopped working in October 2018. It does not heat up anymore. I didn't get six months out of it. I will definitely reach out to the company to receive a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Frances D.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work. Brand new. It will bot get hot after being plugged into the wall for 20 mins
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Buy with caution
customer_reviews.text: Buy with caution iron worked great in the beginning then one day when on the steam setting brown/rust colored water and steam started spurting out of the vent holes (and all over my white shirt) luckily I was still with in my return period with Amazon I just traded it in for a new one with no problems seems to be working fine for now
customer_reviews.author: BourgeoisieBabeOnaBudget

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It’s been only two months since I bought it now it doesn’t work anymore. It would turn on but no heat. Disappointed. I woundnt recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RAZIA HAPPY

customer_reviews.title: Does what its expected to
customer_reviews.text: Working from home, I rarely have to use an iron, but my wife has to use it daily, as she works in an office environment. Works like a charm and does exactly what you expect, get out wrinkles and make clothes look crisp.
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat up very much at all
customer_reviews.text: Very low power, I should have returned it but was too lazy to
customer_reviews.author: Bindi Jhaveri

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product works well. It's certainly not top of the line, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very rarely do I iron, but this product has consistently worked for me without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sssarah

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I always love B&D products. I wish they came with more options of different colors but other than that everything is good so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Mae

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed that there isn't a steam control on this since I would like to iron things on high heat without steam, but you can't separate the two on this iron. Overall it does work well though.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Hanes

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER Easy Steam Compact Iron, IR40V
product_meta.description: Style Name:Anti-Drip with SmartSteam & Auto Shut OffCompact yet powerful, this easy-to-use nonstick iron features proprietary SmartSteam technology, automatically regulating steam level based on fabric setting to streamline controls and take the guesswork out of ironing. The 3-way auto shutoff provides added peace of mind.
feature_bullets: SmartSteam Technology - This proprietary technology automatically regulates the amount of steam based on the temperature setting to streamline controls for optimal results

3-Way Auto Shutoff- Get peace of mind with motion-sensitive technology that automatically shuts off the iron if left inactive on its heel, side or soleplate.Wipe soleplate and outer surfaces with a soft cloth dampened with water
Anti-Drip- Engineered to prevent dripping by maintaining water at the proper temperature needed to generate steam. Volts : 120V. Wattage : 1200W
TrueGlide Nonstick Soleplate-The enhanced soleplate is designed to glide smoothly across all fabric types for ease of use
Spray Mist- This push-button mister helps moisten fabrics to tackle and smooth away deep wrinkles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,214 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
